text: Does anyone have a good example of long form ungated content? Have an ebook and I'm trying to work out the best way to make it interactive, navigatable, etc... instead of just gating a PDF.

text:
We completely ungated our report last year:

<https://soapboxhq.com/state-of-one-on-ones-report>

This year, I’m building it all on a webpage, vs. a landing page -> pdf

text: :slightly_smiling_face:
Similar to <@U010JU2GTND>, we’ve put some TOFU SEO-friendly long-form content on our website as pages <https://www.pathfactory.com/account-based-marketing/>

elements.text: Similar to
, we’ve put some TOFU SEO-friendly long-form content on our website as pages

text: We also split a long eBook into chapters and turned each chapter into its own asset, encouraging people to read them in sequence. <https://pathfac.to/2Q4N9xs> If someone (who’s known) spends a good chunk of time engaging with a chapter or two, we’ll send them an email the next day encouraging them to come back and read the rest, which has been really successful so far. Should have a blog post about this whole campaign up in a few weeks.

attachments.title: Part 1: Consumerized B2B buyers and customers
attachments.text: PathFactory removes friction from B2B marketing and sales by delivering intelligent content across the customer journey.
attachments.fallback: Nurture Now: Part 1: Consumerized B2B buyers and customers

elements.text: We also split a long eBook into chapters and turned each chapter into its own asset, encouraging people to read them in sequence.

text: Hey everyone! We're in the midst of a onboarding email rejig and while we're brainstorming design, flow etc, I wanted some suggestions on what's the best content to push? The obvious seems to be case studies, testimonials, but what could be other *relevant content?* If you've got an example you love or have thoughts around it, do share. Thanks!

text:
Hello! I am wondering if anyone in this group specialize in press release strategy?

I am looking for guidance (hourly consulting) for how to distribute this resource:
<https://storyhackers.com/pandemic>

Recommendations welcome. Thank you immensely.

text:

• Each email tied to one action
• Link 1 content asset to each email

text:
If you have a saas product, you could also send them usage emails as to what they've achieved each week using your product.

Example: Grammarly sends out engaging emails with personalized metrics on how many words were corrected, writing tone etc.
